results.title: Hard boiled
results.creator_credit: John Woo, Linda Kuk, Terence Chang, Golden Princess and Milestone Pictures
results.brief_description: The relationship between police inspector Yeun (Chow Yun-Fat) and gangster hitman Tony (Tony Leung), who is in reality an undercover cop, is similar to the friendship between the two main characters in Woo’s previous film “The Killer”. But here, more than in earlier films, stylised action and gun play take centre stage in stunningly choreographed mayhem. This is a classic example of Hong Kong style action films and is a perfect introduction to John Woo’s pre-Hollywood films. In Cantonese with English subtitles.

results.title: Antonia's line
results.creator_credit: Marleen Gorris, Hans De Weers, Bard Entertainment, Bergen, NPS Televisie and Prime Time
results.brief_description: This film traces fifty years in the life of Antonia, a strong willed matriarch who founds a dynasty after returning to her village in the Dutch countryside shortly after World War II. The narrator, Antonia’s great-granddaughter, emphasises the cyclical nature of life in a small rural community. Cast includes Willeke van Ammelrooy, Els Sottermans, Jan Decleir, Marina de Graaf and Mil Seghers. In Dutch with English subtitles.

results.title: The Enforcer
results.creator_credit: Brent Productions, Milton Sperling and Warner Bros Pictures
results.brief_description: Humphrey Bogart portrays District Attorney Martin Ferguson whose efforts to crack an organised crime syndicate are jeopardised by the suicide of his sole eyewitness on the eve of the trial. Ferguson has only 12 hours to prepare a new case in order to bring crime boss Albert Mendoza (Everett Sloane) to justice. A suspenseful thriller written by Martin Rackin and based on the ‘Murder Inc.’ case. Cast also includes Zero Mostel, Ted De Corsia, Roy Roberts and Lawrence Tolan. Music by David Buttolph, cinematography by Robert Burks and editing by Fred Allen.

results.title: Killer's kiss
results.creator_credit: Stanley Kubrick, Morris Bousel, Metro-Goldwyn-Mayer and Minotaur Productions
results.brief_description: A struggling boxer recounts how his attraction to a young woman has drawn him into a world of shadows and omnipresent violence which threatens to overwhelm him. His life becomes imperiled when he protects a nightclub dancer from her gangster boss. Although filmed in New York locations, Kubrick’s independently financed second feature has the atmosphere of a waking nightmare rather than that of realistically based drama. Cast includes Frank Silvera, Jamie Smith, Irene Kane and Ruth Sobotka.

results.title: Primary colors
results.creator_credit: Mike Nichols, Mutual Film Company and Universal Pictures
results.brief_description: Jack Stanton is a governor from a small southern state who, while sincere in his devotion to the American people, is nevertheless plagued by scandal at every twist on the campaign trail to the presidency. Includes music score by Ry Cooder. Cast includes John Travolta, Emma Thompson, Billy Bob Thornton, Kathy Bates, Adrian Lester, Larry Hagman and Diane Ladd.

results.title: Born to be wild
results.creator_credit: John Gray, Jeffrey Silver, Robert Newmyer, Outlaw Productions and Warner Bros Pictures
results.brief_description: Katie is a very special three year old gorilla who knows how to communicate using sign language and loves to talk to her friend, Rick (Will Horneff). Rick meets Katie through his mother, a behavioural scientist who is so busy working with animals that she doesn’t have time for her son who is sinking into juvenile delinquency. Their friendship is threatened when Katie is reclaimed by her former owner and put in a cage with the intention of being used as an attraction at the flea market. Rick helps Katie escape and together they embark on an exciting wilderness adventure from California to Canada and having a lot of fun along the way. Cast includes Wil Horneff, Helen Shaver, John C McGinley and Peter Boyle.

results.title: Somewhere in time
results.creator_credit: Jeannot Szwarc, Stephen Deutsch and Universal Pictures
results.brief_description: A man is given an antique gold watch from an old woman who pleads with him to travel back in time with her. Years later, the man, Richard, is overwhelmed by a photograph of a beautiful woman. Seeing a picture of the woman in her later years, Richard realises that she is the same woman who gave him the watch, and that they had an affair the time the photo was taken. He becomes obsessed with returning to 1912 and being reunited with the young woman and is willing to sacrifice his life in the present to find happiness in the past. Cast includes Christopher Reeve, Jane Seymour, Christopher Plummer and Teresa Wright. Based on the novel “Bid time return” by Richard Matheson.

results.title: Beetle juice
results.creator_credit: Tim Burton, Larry Wilson, Michael Bender, Richard Hashimoto and The Geffen Company
results.brief_description: Geena Davis and Alec Baldwin are happy, content and alive until a car accident turns them into ghosts, forever stuck in an afterlife - a holding cell for people who have died of unnatural causes. No sooner is the funeral over and their home is sold and “invaded” by two new trendy tenants. In desperation they enlist the help of a freelance bio-exorcist, Betelgeuse (Michael Keaton), to scare the new owners off the premises. This notion provides Keaton with a vehicle for showing off his comic talents. Story by Michael McDowell and Larry Wilson with music by Danny Elfman. Cast includes Geena Davis, Alec Baldwin, Michael Keaton, Catherine O’Hara and Winona Ryder. (Awards: Oscar for Best Achievement in Makeup).

results.title: The Killing
results.creator_credit: Stanley Kubrick, James B. Harris, Harris-Kubrick Pictures Corporation and Metro-Goldwyn-Mayer
results.brief_description: A race-track robbery is planned with clockwork precision but Kubrick dispassionately observes how the mechanism is ruined by human fallibility. The intricate flashback structure presents a plot of chess-like moves in a hard boiled, visually stylised underworld richly populated by film noir stereotypes. Based on the novel “Clean Break” by Lionel White. Cast includes Sterling Hayden, Coleen Gray, Vince Edwards and Jay C Flippen.

results.title: Breaking up
results.creator_credit: Robert Greenwald, George Moffly, Monarchy Enterprises B. V. and Regency Entertainment (USA)
results.brief_description: Using vignettes, still photos, interviews, and the New York landscape, this film follows the trials and tribulations of Steve (Russell Crowe) and Monica’s (Salma Hayek) tumultuous relationship that vacillates between being together, and breaking up. The two realise that they can’t live with each other, but can’t do without the other either and are trapped in a continuous process of breaking up then making up. Ultimately, they have to decide what it is that’s holding them together when the excitement of their renewed sexual attraction that occurs when they make up seems to be the overarching link between them. Written by Pulitzer Prize winner Michael Cristofer.
